intro: Sinoseris muliensis, commonly known as the Muli sandwort, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Sichuan Province in China. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and delicate, white or pale pink flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Its unique adaptations allow it to survive in harsh conditions, making it an important species for ecological studies in alpine ecosystems. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Sinoseris muliensis is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
